title: How will artificial intelligence (AI) change the retail industry in 2019? - Quora

response.answer_text: Over the last few years, artificial intelligence technology has made some interesting advancements across multiple industries. Even though not every retailer has been using it due to high costs, the largest players in the retailing have been pretty active about it. It's no wonder, given the benefits AI can bring to the actual businesses. A.I can give more in-depth knowledge of customers. You see, A.I can be used to review actual sales data linked to the customer data. When this information is run through the machine learning algorithms, new information about a business, customers, and inventory is created which are not known to the business owner. Nike has created ‘Nike Live’ -- a responsive, hyper-locally curated, retail space designed to be a geographically specific culture hub. They’ve taken data from all of their Nike apps and online shoppers in specific locations and created a place that offers the customization of an online shopping experience and brought it to life.  Meanwhile, stores such as Sephora have fully embraced technology and created a ‘Virtual Artist’ — a “3D live experience” that allows shoppers to upload a photo and virtually try on lipstick, blush, eye shadow and other cosmetic products — essentially, a valuable try-before-you-buy tool that saves time and money.  McDonald’s has partnered with Uber Eats, an offshoot of rideshare company Uber, which allows users to order and have delivered food from select restaurants via their website or a smartphone or tablet. British online fashion retailer Asos.com also is using AI to help shoppers choose the right sizes. The retailer analyzes which items customers keep and in which sizes versus items that get returned most often. Using machine learning, Asos can then recommend appropriate sizes for individual customers. As a result, returns are minimized, the customer experience is better, and Asos reduces costs. So retailers have a lot of catching up to do, as the wild world of e-commerce takes a deeper turn into the world of A.I!

The impact of AI is already witnessed in the retail industry. While once retailers were struggling with forecasting demand and trends in the fast-paced industry of retail, with the onset of AI technology retailers have been able to overcome forecasting demands and sales. Product recommendation is a feature which is being implemented by most of the E-retailers. Last-mile deliveries of the product have been made more optimized and efficient with the help of AI. The supply chain of warehouses and stores has become more advanced due to the transparency in inventory. These developments are remarkable, yet we will be able to see more impacts of AI in the field of retailing. Customers want to see how the product will look like on them and very soon it will be a common feature in the stores where they will have a trial room with touch-free monitors and gesture walls and will be able to browse through a recommendation based on on their style quotient. Customers love to shop without salespeople bothering them and still want assistance with the direction and information. With the help of AI, customers will be able to get instant support through smart analytics and natural language processing technology. There will be robots and touch panels which will help customers to find items and information. Such customer service bots will increase accuracy, enhance customer experience and reduce manpower costs. Vision technologies powered with AI will help decode customer behavior and retailers will be able to improve their operations for higher revenues. E-retailers will be able to improve their supply chain by leveraging the autonomous vehicles for their last-mile deliveries. With AI, retailers will be able to schedule productions and will be able to identify issues and resolve them instantly. Manual tasks of evaluating suppliers will be automated with the help of AI, which will increase productivity and improve order turnaround time.
